Procedure Following the Adverse Action Proposal Period
Claims processors must follow the steps in the table below at the end of the adverse action proposal period.
Step
Action
1
Compose the final decision notice with all of the required elements and language.
Note
:  When completing the final decision notice, do not re-summarize any evidence referenced in the notice of proposed adverse action.
References
:  For more information on
the required elements of the final decision notice, see
38 CFR 3.103(f)
decision notices, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.B
, and
when to provide a summary of evidence in a decision notice, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.B.1.f
.
2
Send the final decision notice to the beneficiary and the beneficiary's representative, if any.
Reference
:  For more information on determining
who receives a notice, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 1.B.1.c
.
3
Clear any applicable EPs that were pending during the adverse action proposal period.
Reference
:  For more information on EPs relevant to the adverse action proposal period, see
M21-4, Appendix B
, and
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.B.4.b
.
